place.name: EASTWELL
place.gazetteerText: EASTWELL, a parish in Melton-Mowbray district, Leicester; on the Wolds, 6½ miles NNE of Melton-Mowbray town and r. station. It has a post office under Melton-Mowbray. Acres, 1, 346. Real property, £2, 081. Pop., 160. Houses, 34. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £372.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is tolerable; and there is a Roman Catholic chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
